page.title: 04The Village of East Brent
page.content: The origins of the village date back for centuries. It is on the east side of the Knoll, but stretches away across flat land as far as the A 38. The church and school are built at the foot of the Knoll and the oldest houses are close to the church. East Brent has two small council house estates,including some bungalows specially built for elderly people. There has been some new houses built ths year, both singly and as small estates. The older houses are built singly with quite large gardens. The newer houses are in groups and close together. There are some large farm houses on the outskirts of the village, these are usually isolated and in the centre of their own land.
